title: 113_s2952
content: The "Evidence-Based Policymaking Commission Act of 2014" establishes the Commission on Evidence-Based Policymaking in the executive branch. The Commission on Evidence-Based Policymaking is comprised of 15 members appointed by the President, Speaker of the House, and Minority Leader of the House. Appointments include individuals with expertise in academic research, data management, program administration, and privacy matters. The Commission on Evidence-Based Policymaking consists of 15 members appointed by various leaders. Each leader appoints individuals with expertise in academic research, data management, program administration, confidentiality, and privacy matters. The Commission on Evidence-Based Policymaking consists of 15 members appointed by various leaders. Three members are appointed by the Minority Leader of the Senate, including 2 academic researchers or data experts, and 1 with expertise in database management and privacy matters. The President selects the chairperson, and the Speaker of the House selects the co-chairperson. Appointments must be made within 45 days of the Act's enactment, and members serve without pay for the duration of the Commission. Vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Each member of the Commission appointed for the duration of the Commission. Vacancies filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Members serve without pay and allowed travel expenses for Commission-related travel. The Commission's duties are outlined in Section 4. The Commission is tasked with conducting a study on data inventory, infrastructure, and protocols related to Federal policymaking. This includes integrating data for program evaluation, making recommendations for data infrastructure modifications, and incorporating outcomes measurement into program design. Additionally, the Commission will consider creating a clearinghouse for program and survey data. The Commission is considering creating a clearinghouse for program and survey data, which involves evaluating relevant administrative datasets, linking them to survey datasets, addressing legal and administrative barriers, determining data-sharing infrastructure, funding mechanisms, access for qualified researchers, and limitations on data use. The Commission is exploring data-sharing infrastructure, funding mechanisms, access for researchers, limitations on data use, privacy protection, and incentives for interagency information sharing to improve program effectiveness. Upon agreement by three-quarters of the members, the Commission will submit detailed findings, conclusions, and recommendations to the President and Congress. The Commission will submit a detailed report to the President and Congress within 15 months of the majority of members being appointed, containing findings, conclusions, and recommendations for legislation or administrative actions based on the study of administrative data. Administrative data refers to information generated or collected by agencies for Federal programs. The Commission will have operational powers as outlined in Section 5. The Commission will receive administrative assistance from various government agencies and will hold meetings as determined by the chairperson. Rules of procedure will be established with the approval of the majority of Commission members. The Commission, upon majority appointment, will establish rules of procedure, hold hearings, contract for necessary services, use the United States mails, accept gifts, and receive administrative assistance from government agencies. The Commission may use the United States mails, accept gifts, and receive funding from principal statistical agencies for its operations, not to exceed $2,000,000. The Commission shall have a Director appointed by the chairperson with the concurrence of the co-chairperson, paid at a rate not to exceed level V of the Executive Schedule. The Director may appoint additional staff and procure temporary services. The Commission shall terminate within 18 months of the Act's enactment.
